title.rendered: Dispensing System Market is expected to reach US$ 101.0 billion by 2034, expanding at a 6.7% CAGR

content.rendered:
Eco-friendly Materials and Energy-efficient Designs Take Center Stage in Dispensing System Development. Rising demand across automotive, electronics, healthcare, and food & beverage sectors fuels growth of Dispensing System Market. Precision dispensing meets diverse industry needs, minimizing errors and optimizing efficiency.

NEWARK, Del, Feb. 23, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — According to Future Market Insights, the dispensing system market is expected to reach a valuation of US$ 52.9 billion in 2024 and grow to US$ 101.0 billion by 2034. Experts anticipate a steady growth trajectory during this period, with a predicted CAGR of 6.7%.

Advanced dispensing technologies with precise control mechanisms meet the requirements for accuracy and consistency, particularly in sectors like electronics manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, and automotive assembly. These systems optimize material usage, minimize spillage, and contribute to sustainability efforts, aligning with the global trend toward eco-friendly manufacturing practices.

Continuous advancements in dispensing technologies, such as integration with robotics and IoT, are driving market growth, particularly in emerging economies like China, Japan, South Korea, and the United States. Manual dispensing systems offer unique flexibility, control, and cost-effectiveness advantages, especially for industries with diverse or customized product lines.

Gain Valuable Insights from Industry Experts to Shape Your Growth Strategies. Access our Sample Report Now https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/reports/sample/rep-gb-19033

With the increasing popularity of electric vehicles and autonomous driving systems, there is a growing need for dispensing systems capable of handling complex electronic components with high precision. As automotive manufacturers strive to meet evolving consumer demands for safer, more sustainable, and technologically advanced vehicles, the demand for advanced dispensing solutions is expected to continue growing. This further reinforces the automotive industry’s position as a leading segment in the dispensing system market.

The healthcare industry is another sector where dispensing systems are becoming more common. These systems help healthcare professionals administer precise medication dosages, reducing the chances of human error and improving patient outcomes. Dispensing systems play a vital role in the food and beverage industry, where they help maintain consistency and accuracy in the production process, contributing to better-quality products.

With the rise of innovative applications of dispensing technologies, such as 3D printing and automated drug delivery systems, the market for advanced dispensing solutions is expected to expand further in the coming years. This expansion is projected to offer new opportunities for market players in various industries.

“The increasing adoption of automation and Industry 4.0 technologies, along with the rise of emerging technologies like electric vehicles, IoT, and 5G, are likely to drive innovation in dispensing technologies. The focus on sustainability and eco-friendly manufacturing practices is also likely to drive innovation in dispensing technologies. Expanding applications in healthcare, cosmetics, construction, and emerging markets in Asia Pacific and Latin America are forecasted to further bolster the expansion of the dispensing system market,” opines Nikhil Kaitwade, Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights (FMI)

Key Takeaways from the Market Study 

  • Manual dispensing technology is projected to dominate the dispensing system market with a 6.5% CAGR through 2034.
  • Automotive is set to lead the application type in the dispensing system industry, registering a 6.3% CAGR through 2034.
  • The dispensing system market in South Korea has the potential to increase at a 9.1% CAGR through 2034.
  • Sales of dispensing systems in the United Kingdom are predicted to rise by a moderate 7.7% CAGR through 2034.
  • The dispensing system industry in Japan is projected to inflate at a CAGR of 8.4% through 2034.
  • The adoption of dispensing systems in China is anticipated to develop at a 7.5% CAGR through 2034.
  • The dispensing system demand in the United States is estimated to rise at a whopping 6.9% CAGR through 2034.

Competitive Landscape 

The dispensing system market is thriving as companies innovate and offer advanced solutions tailored to the needs of various industries. Key players such as Nordson Corporation, Silgan Holdings Inc., and Nordson ASYMTEK drive market expansion through research and development, strategic acquisitions, and partnerships.

Companies are developing cutting-edge dispensing technologies, integrating robotics and IoT capabilities, and expanding their global presence to capture emerging opportunities in sectors like automotive, electronics, healthcare, and consumer goods.

With a focus on sustainability, companies like Nordson, Graco Inc., and Dover Corporation offer eco-friendly dispensing solutions to meet the growing demand for environmentally conscious manufacturing practices.

Top 10 Key Players in the Dispensing System Market

  • Graco Inc
  • Nordson Corporation
  • Techcon Systems
  • Henkel AG & Co KGaA
  • ABB Ltd.
  • AptarGroup, Inc.
  • Dover Corporation
  • Franklin Fueling Systems
  • ITW
  • Jensen Global

Recent Developments: 

  • Nordson exhibited its Semiconductor Advanced Packaging Solutions at SEMICON Taiwan 2023, featuring an ASYMTEK Vantage® dispensing system with dual IntelliJet® valves for high-speed fluid jetting.
  • Silgan Dispensing introduced a sustainable refillable fragrance solution, reducing plastic usage in dispensers by approximately 33% with the Replay solution.
  • JVM, an affiliate of Hanmi Science, launched a next-generation automated drug dispensing system featuring the high-end robot arm ‘MENITH,’ showcasing innovative advancements in pharmaceutical automation.

Dispensing System Market Segmentation

By Technology:

  • Manual Dispensing
  • Robotic Dispensing
  • Semi-Robotic Dispensing
  • Battery Grade

By Application:

  • Automotive
  • Chemicals
  • Electronics
  • Others

By Region:

  • Asia Pacific
  • Europe
  • North America
  • Middle East & Africa
  • Latin America

Author:

Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.) has over a decade of experience in market research and business consulting. He has successfully delivered 1500+ client assignments, predominantly in Automotive, Chemicals, Industrial Equipment, Oil & Gas, and Service industries.

His core competency circles around developing research methodology, creating a unique analysis framework, statistical data models for pricing analysis, competition mapping, and market feasibility analysis. His expertise also extends wide and beyond analysis, advising clients on identifying growth potential in established and niche market segments, investment/divestment decisions, and market entry decision-making.

Nikhil holds an MBA degree in Marketing and IT and a Graduate in Mechanical Engineering. Nikhil has authored several publications and quoted in journals like EMS Now, EPR Magazine, and EE Times.

Explore wide-ranging Coverage of FMI’s Industrial Automation Market Insights Landscape

  • The dispensing robots market is anticipated to grow at a CAGR of 13.8% from 2022 to 2032. By 2032, it is estimated to have grown from US$ 1.5 billion in 2022 to US$ 5.46 billion in valuation.
  • The global marine hatch covers market is projected to record a robust CAGR of 7.6% between 2023 and 2033, totaling around US$ 327.7 million by the end of 2033.
  • The India electrical testing services market is expected to reach a valuation of US$ 308.4 million by 2033 with a CAGR of 4.4% from 2023 to 2033.
  • The global industrial weighing equipment market is projected to reach US$ 2.4 billion by 2033. A CAGR worth 5% is expected for the market during the forecast period.
  • The worldwide material handling equipment market is expected to record a 4.5% CAGR between 2023 and 2033, reaching a valuation of US$ 6,555.9 million.
  • The duct fans market is expected to rise to US$ 162,788.1 million by 2033. The sales are expected to record a significant CAGR of 6.0% during the forecast period.
  • The combined cooling heat and power plants market is expected to grow at an impressive 5.8% CAGR through 2033, when it is expected to be valued US$ 4.0 billion.
  • By 2033, the power quality equipment market is expected to be valued US$ 69.65 billion. Over the course of the projected period, power-quality equipment sales are anticipated to increase at a CAGR of 6.25%.

About Future Market Insights (FMI)

Future Market Insights, Inc. (ESOMAR certified, recipient of the Stevie Award, and a member of the Greater New York Chamber of Commerce) offers profound insights into the driving factors that are boosting demand in the market. FMI stands as the leading global provider of market intelligence, advisory services, consulting, and events for the Packaging, Food and Beverage, Consumer Technology, Healthcare, Industrial, and Chemicals markets. With a vast team of over 5000 analysts worldwide, FMI provides global, regional, and local expertise on diverse domains and industry trends across more than 110 countries.
